review: This review is based on our take out experience that we do almost on a weekly basis. First off, Red Robin's has a pretty easy to use online take out order system. This allows us to come in, get our favorite food, and eat it in a more calm and comfortable place. I say that because sometimes you want the Red Robin food, but not the busy and loud atmosphere that it often has. Because it is takeout, we haven't had much interactions with the servers, but for the most part they seem active in their work and friendly. As for food, I wouldn't steer far from what they are known for- burgers. The classic gourmet is what they are known for, and possibly their only real home run as for 5 star food.  I've noticed they can be pretty skimpy with the sauces and fries, so don't be afraid to ask for more. We love this place-more for its takeout and classic gourmet, and will definitely return for that.

I had never been to a Red Robin before I moved to the PNW, and I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service. I think there's something a little weird about being called "honey" but a server, but there's also something weirdly nice about it, too. And the burger -- damn, yum! And I even got the chicken version of Madlove and felt that way. As for the fries, they were pretty good, too, though I will say they need about 3x the garlic. (I ordered the garlic fries.) Bottom line: Why 2.5 stars? The servers here are great and burgers yum.

Came here tonight for a friend's birthday and waited 20 minutes at our table before we were able to flag someone down just to order drinks and starters. Another 5 minutes passed and the waiter finally came to take our order. We decided to get drinks, appetizers, and entrees at the same time, because it was already getting late. Tonight's service was extremely poor. This was the first time I've been back in about 3 years. I think this will be the last time. One star, because that's the lowest Yelp will allow, and because the ladies at the front were helpful.

Are here over the weekend with my husband. I ordered a sandwich and he got a burger. Both items had lettuce. I took two bites of my sandwich and something tasted off. The kitchen manager was very rude and assured me everything was cooked to kill bacteria. I advised him bacteria exists on produce which is not cooked and he rolled his eyes at me. Three days later, we are both exhibiting symptoms of e. Coli, for which there is currently an outbreak in lettuce. His symptoms are markedly worse than mine because he ate his whole sandwich. 0/10 will ever eat at Red Robin again.

Went to Everett Red Robin today.  The meal was gross............egg on burger was burned and side of apples was not any good period.  Staff is not well educated on jobs.  Very poor service.............very poor management.......they would not do anything about the poor food.  I will never go to Red Robin again. Connie

Nothing worse than waiting 55 minutes for an online order you placed that said 16 minutes wait and your food is cold and soggy. Forgot half my order in the back. Should have learned when I ordered online last time and this happened.

I've dined at many Red Robin restaurants in my day and this location has got to have the fastest and friendliest service! If you're like me, the only reason why you hit up a RR is for the bottomless fries, right? Well, here at this location if: 1. You want a refill of fries? Coming right up, literally within a couple minutes.  2. You want some more campfire sauce for your fries, sure thing! Literally the next time you look up, your waitress or one of her fellow waitstaff is already setting your request on your table. 3. You want another beer or drink, no worries...sit at the bar area and you'll still receive the super fast service!  And you actually don't have to order a burger in order to get their bottomless fries deal. Just order any of their $7-$9 appetizers and you're golden! I was all potato'd out that night...however, as I'm writing this review, my mouth is already watering for more steak fry goodness at Red Robin.

We will not be back to Red Robin they cater to the drinking crowd now!!!!!! we spent time there with my family my wife my daughter my grandchildren the people in the booth adjacent to us we're extremely loud foul-mouthed belligerent  the waitress did nothing when we complained I think she was a friend to the group or afraid to lose the customers who spent the most money. Came for a what we expected to be a enjoyable family moment and turned into a Fiasco whirlwind nightmare
Worst organized place I've ever been to. A meal ordered to go means a long wait, no customer service, and food that goes cold while you wait too long. Every. Single. Time.
Price: $-$$ Service: Super friendly and attentive!! Thanks, Brooke! 5 Stars!! Food: My selection was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Location: Not a large place but great family friendly atmosphere.

Last 3 times I was there, I gave them my phone number for royalty club points. few days later when I checked by transactions on there royalty website then I realized that last 3 times within 2 weeks I was there, they didn't put in my phone number I gave them for the rewards and I missed $130 of points. I went back to talk to a Manager. A very unprofessional guy showed up with the name of WILLY. claimed himself as a Resturant Manager. I explained him the situation and also told him to verify with the servers that we were here but he refused to do anything and said its too bad. I mean its just not about points but if you are a manager then you should know how to address things

Really horrible location of Red Robin.  Avoid it at all costs. It's dirty, not a nice location. Service is horrible.  I asked twice for an allergy menu and finally looked it up online as the server kept forgetting to bring it.  He brought the wrong drinks for the kids.  Then he forgot to put in one of our hamburger orders so we waited forever.  To top it off, the manager or supervisor came by to ask how things were going... I told her we still were missing an entrée and she acted as if it was my fault!  Once she finally realized that no one put in the order, she came over to apologize, but really it's not acceptable to blame the customer for poor service!  Everyone was just really unfriendly and unhelpful.   At least they comped us for that entrée! Food was average at best.  There are better Red Robins out there. BTW, the new interactive screens they put at the table are not a good idea.  I don't think we should be training our kids to play video games during a meal and by having it so front and center, it just creates friction if you don't want your kid to use it.  There are better ways to keep kids engaged at the dinner table!

The worst red robin I have ever been to. Came here on Tuesday around 8PM. Was not busy at all. Took the front greeter almost ten minutes to seat two of us. Once seated (to the right of the entrance area they have a dining area that's less attractive then McDonald's dining area. It's right next to the kitchen.) The waitress took almost 10 minutes to get our drink orders which at that point we decided to put our dinner orders in as well since we didn't want a long wait again. She took our orders and I specifically stated NO PINK in my burger. Another 15 minutes go by, drinks have been empty for close to 5 minutes and she comes out with the food. My friends fish and chips were burnt. I took 2 bites of my burger and it was PINK. Not even a little bit but completely PINK. I ate my fries and we waited for her to come back. I told her the burger was pink and she took it to the back,  manager came out and asked if I would like a reorder of the burger I said no she asked if I'd like something else I said sure chicken Caesar wrap to go. The manager was going to comp the meal and obviously since she asked and wanted to remedy the situation the wrap to go as well. The waitress comes back to ring us out and took a measly $5 off the total!! Horrible service and horrible food. Won't be back here and won't refer anyone to visit this RR location.

With two kids that are 6 & 3 1/2, over the years we've learned our lesson to not go on any family lunches or dinners, maybe only once in awhile. Well today our boys decided to behave themselves (wait, what?!  there is a higher power!!!) My husband and I thought, 'Omg, we finally get to sit down and enjoy our lunch, for once!' Well we were wrong; despite our boys' best behavior (okay, maybe a little bit of scolding to put the fear of momma bear in them) we received really bad service  Waters were not brought to us; had to ask twice. Bottomless fries were forgotten, twice.  I surveyed the restaurant, it wasnt busy, so I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt, maybe they were short staffed, or the BOH/kitchen was short. Our server was pregnant so I did sympathize and had empathy for her but my hubby's burger he ordered, was NOT the one he ordered. He doesnt like to complain so he just ate it  By the time we really wanted to leave the fries finally came out, service today sucked.
Their website sucks.  It's frustrating, it freezes and it wastes your time.  Don't order via their website!  They have the worst online ordering of any place that offers online ordering.

I'll start by saying usually the food is good and service decent. Tonight was an exception. The pretzel bites were highly over cooked. Nearly burnt. The salad was underwhelming. I ordered the bbq chicken salad which comes with Baja veggies, lime and garlic bread. The salad was a thin layer of green leaves. Some small cut tomatoes and chicken with a little bit bbq sauce. All the items that make the bbq salad unique were.missing. no baba veggies, no lime, no garlic bread.... my husband is uncomfortable with complaining so I just ate it and left disappointed.   Yelp is my outlet. Thanks for listening. Hopefully the red robin crew will read the reviews and attempt to make things better.

This place was super crowded on a recent Friday night visit. The parking lot was full and people were standing everywhere waiting for tables. I tried to avoid this and sit in the bar, only to find a table with one seat and another chair off to the side. I moved the seat to the table and was quickly told this was a 1 seat table due to the blocking of the aisle way. The design of this part of the bar section seems very poorly laid out. It appears this location is in the midway process of some remodeling and looks pretty awful at present.  I got seated quicker than the quoted wait for the main dining area and had my beverages super fast, but it took forever for the food to come. The whole section I was sitting in was people with beverages only who waited a long time for food. It appeared many of the servers were standing in the kitchen area waiting for their food orders to come up. The table next to us was lucky enough to get some fries ahead of time, but we had not realized this was something we should request in advance. Food eventually came and was delicious.  I love the customizability of the food here. I am huge fan of the nutrition calculator on the website. I was hoping to have this kind of maneuverability on the new table machines, but seems you can only order appetizers, desserts and drinks from this. I was also disturbed to learn that the machine offers games which could have helped me pass the very long wait, but they require an additional charge of 1.99$ which is then added to your bill. It seems very easy to click on this and end up paying which I am sure could upset some parents with curious children. I did appreciate it had a few free features, the ability to join the rewards program and a faster way to pay.  A manager was nice enough to stop by and apologize for the wait on more than one occasion. I also was able to get 2 refills of broccoli which can be exchanged for the never ending fries. Our server was highly attentive and made sure we had a lot of refills and also kept us informed on the wait. I love that you can sub a boca burger to any sandwich here and will continue to frequent but may wait til the remodel is completed and its less hectic.

Since the remodel and menu revision, this specific Red Robin is just sluggish an a drab. The server was super nice, but incredibly way too busy. She tried her best, but her section was way to big...causing her to not allow for enough attention to be devoted to each table.  We were sat a table that still needed to wiped off, so we were loved to another table. The food came out incredibly slow, the appetizer came out after the 3 of the 4 entrees...the 4th enter came out after the 3 were eaten 3/4....so I didn't get to enjoy my food with the company I came with. We actually had to call the manager over to inform her that the salad was less the edible. She did take it off the bill, to sum it up.  I don't think I'll be coming back...which is a major BUMMER, cause we loved this place. :-(

Been dining at Red Robin for years. Food in Everett is still good, but couple of real turn-offs: Ziosk's on tables, and service. We quit eating at Red Robin a couple years back when Ziosk's were first introduced. Tried them again, and they are still the center-piece on all tables. First Ziosk's. Who wants to go out for lunch or dinner, and have a tablet in the middle of the table pushing advertising and games? Very distracting when having a conversation, so we just place it face down on the table.  The Ziosk's also have a microphone and camera. How does Red Robin use audio and video from tables? Lastly, we had to pay using the Ziosk. Apple Pay did not work, nor did the chip reader, so we had to use the mag strip/swipe method. Really unsecure. I wonder when a hack or skim will take place. Second, wait staff pretty underwhelming. There were a group of them near our table having a great conversation with each other, at the expense of paying customers. Will give them a try in another couple of years.

RR is undergoing quite a few renovations. I assume the face lift is due to the surrounding competing restaurants such as Bob's Burgers and Brews, NYP Grill and Buffalo Wild Wings. Tablets have been placed on every table. The tablets can essentially take all personal interaction out of the equation if that is what one prefers. Notifying the server, placing orders, paying tabs and playing games (for a fee) can all be done through these. It's still disappointing that RR doesn't offer a happy hour. Because of this, I will always choose to dine and drink at the above establishments.

Ridiculous wait time for any parties over 4 people. We had 1st asked for a table for 5. We had 4 people that needed to sit & an infant that was being held the whole time. They said it would be a 20 min. wait & then we said to the front lady that it was actually only 4. They took in 4 different groups of 4 people before we were seated. Then when we were we were put in a booth that hardly fit 4 people & was right acrossed from the people that were seated right before us & they arrived at the restaurant 20 mins after us. We waited 40 mins. total. It was obviously poorly manage up front & when We had asked about the wait they had looked clueless & said you'll be next, they are cleaning the table now. That was said before they took in a bunch of groups before us. Then I wasn't impressed with the food at all. It was all half par. The waiter was the onky good thing there. He was nice & a tentative. I'm Not going to be running back there anytime soon.

Our servers was a gal named Devin tonight. She was awesome. Very prompt, polite and funny. She made sure we had everything we needed quickly. We came in at 6 on and Friday and even though she was busy we never felt like we needed for anything. Red Robin food is the same everywhere but service from Devin will keep us coming back to the Everett location.

We had a great lunch. I had the banzai burger which was really tasty along with bottomless garlic Parmesan fries and I washed it down with a raspberry limeade (new favorite instead of freckled lemonade). Everything was good and service was great for it being busy. The people next to us did get there order before us even though they ordered after us (maybe 10 min difference) but that was just a little annoying.

This RR is bottom of the barrel in the north end. Service is always slow, tables are left dirty, the floor feels like its got a coat of grease. Monroe and Alderwood due a much better job and the food is just a little better.

I like this location, normally it's ok but this particular day, it was amazing! I did start to feel bad for the table behind us they were completely ignored for about a hour before we got there but the waiter took care of it and was very apologetic I would definitely return

Gluten free was truly kept GF, thank you! My allergy is a severe one so I appreciate the care. When I asked for a GF menu, our server surprised me with an iPad allowing me to explore my options (and they had so many more options than most restaurants!). I was thrilled at the thought of having fries. GF fries! Oh baby, that was going to be my entree. No other place I've been to makes their fries separately from the gluten contaminated foods.  In fact, I was so eager that I opted for the "lettuce bun" for my sandwich instead of the GF bun just so I could have room for bottomless fries :)  (No pic of the food. I dove in too fast and don't touch my ph once I start eating) Aside from the delightful fries which were perfectly hot and crisp, I had the California chicken sandwich.  A wonderful side.  The chicken was juicy, the bacon was thick and cooked to that just-right mid-range of a little crispy and a little soft. The iceberg lettuce was stacked a bit thickly but was easy enough to peel away to my preference.  Our visit was a Sat nite and the place was packed but we had no problem getting an immediate seat in the bar section. And prompt service! Our server was great (sorry I'm poor with names). He was friendly and checked on us frequently. That was especially nice given the busy-ness of the night. The sign of good staffing? I think so! Our drinks were nummy too.  I had a type of berry margarita and my friend had a summer beer that she liked enough to order again ;)  Next time I'm in town I'll gladly revisit!

This location got remodeled and it looks nice but everything else went downhill. The hostess had an attitude. She tried to seat my mother and I in the middle of a party when the whole place was empty. She got upset when we asked for a booth two steps away. Then she didn't tell any server we were here! Our server was nice and caring. We ordered two burgers and it took about 35 minutes to get to us. When we finally got our food, it was cold and over cooked. The patties were burnt too. You only get about five fries with your meal as well. So if you're a Fri person, you're gonna have to order more. The refills aren't free anymore, they charge you each time. Then while eating , we kept having different people survey us on the food and the restaurant. We waited all this time for our meal and when we finally get it, we kept getting interrupted to be asked questions. We finally finish and are about to leave until one of the managers pops up out of no where to ask us MORE questions.  If you have a lot of time on your hands, love burnt and cold food and like being asked the same five questions over and over by different employees, this is the place for you.

They lost a customer today.  They need to close this place down until they can find effective leadership. Long wait for sub par food.  Skimpy sides and a manger who handles a dirty dish rag and doesn't wash her hands before going back to handling food.  This place is a mess stay away!

Ok for a chain restaurant the burgers... where to start cheap, quick and damn good. The service isn't the best but I could care less once the food arrives. It's rare when we come here so maybe that why I'm a big fan. I will def be back hopefully soon, i love the ghost burger, no cheese please.

Horrible service, food was warm at best. Bartender was more worried about putting on a drama show with her friends than serving her customers. Cocktailer, my actual server, was more concerned with stuffing her mouth, than making a salad for me. The talent has changed over the years, dramatically. Lost a customer

Not really sure what happened to this place, but service has gone down hill.  The server took his sweet time before he came and took our order....Weird part is that it wasn't even busy and no one on our side of the restaurant was even ordering or eating food; just people picking at food and chatting. From the time we got into Red Robin to the time we got our food was 45min....for 2 burgers and fries...and they were cold! And to top it off, to get any service we had to wave them down.  Oh plus, my boyfriend ordered the burger with the fried egg on it and it was severely under cooked; yolk popped and the egg white goozed out of the burger ( see photo). With the lack of service that we got all night we decided to just eat, leave and never return. I'll remember to go to the lynnwood one from now on if I ever want a Red Robin burger.

I have no clue why there are so many bad reviews  every time to go to this location customer service is always amazing  now the only reason I am giving a 4 star is because they were a little slow in bringing the food out .... so I did have to wait a really long time to get my food but I will say my server was constantly and I mean constantly checking on us.  I mean you could see it in her eyes that she was sorry for how long it was taking but I'm not going to take that out on her or the cooks the cooks can only go so quickly it's not their fault that they're understaffed you can't force people to work there . anyway I love the new menu it's amazing the food is always great thank you thank you thank you

I hadn't been to this location in about a year, a lot has changed! I ordered my go to burger, the Red Robin Royal because I love a hamburger with egg on it, and I opted for the gluten free bun. My wife ordered her favorite, the Teriyaki Chicken Burger. The food looked apetizing , but in this case looks were deceiving. If you're on a gluten free diet I would steer clear of ordering a bun here. It was definitely bland and tasteless. Our fries were cold and soggy, not what I expected after waiting 20+ minutes in a nearly empty restaurant. Our server Kayleigh checked back with us halfway through our meal and offered more fries, and I was surprised she asked, considering we both had most of ours left, a sure sign something wasn't right being as a hot crisp Red Robin fry is a thing of deliciousness!

I've been going to this location since childhood and it's kinda gone down hill like the surrounding mall area.  The tables are sticky with age, the place is often full of screaming children, and while the staff are always polite and friendly, they make a lot of mistakes.  They might be understaffed in the kitchen since food takes longer than it does at other RR locations, or maybe there aren't enough waitstaff since its location makes it busy; either way while the food is usually just as good as other RR's, you're probably better off driving a few extra miles and visiting one of the Lynnwood locations.

What happened to this restaurant???  When our kids were growing up, we used to take them here frequently for dinner.  But we visited last week and it may as well have been a completely different restaurant.  Glacial service, food arrived cold and we got the wrong bill.  And all of this when the restaurant was maybe 1/3 full.   This chain would benefit from new ownership and a total revision of its approach to business.

Happy Hour for the hostess??  Never thought we would ever see this happen. What a change after the remodel - hostess service slow, meal delivery slow, Endless Fries are no longer endless and not the same (hard and unseasoned).  Unfortunately approximately twenty minutes later we were headed to the restroom, could be the ranch dressing, hamburger ?? We want our old Red Robin back!!!!

This is my go to spot before seeing a movie, and on several other occasions because of a recent addition to there menu: The Smoke & Pepper Burger, it's simply amazing. It has bacon,cheese, lettuce, and pickles in addition to its 1/2 lb angus beef patty. Priced around $14 it's definitely more than I typically pay for a burger but well worth it. I add grilled onions to mine and ask for an extra sauce (it comes with it's own sauce on the side, not sure what it is but MAKES this burger). So since this discovery I have purposefully come here just to get my burger fix, I actually find myself luring others in to coming with me so they can share in my new discovery.  Basically if your in the area swing thru the burgers are good the service is decent and efficient, there is usually a wait but sometimes you can skip the line by sitting at the bar.

My boyfriend and I came here last night for dinner, we ordered prime rib dip, chili, and a side of fries. Took 45 minutes to get our food and when it came it was cold and the fries were half cooked. The chili seemed like it was just taken out of the fridge. They took the chili away and brought me another. Halfway through me eating this chili, I found a square plastic bread bag tie. I was so grossed out and both of us felt sick after the food. Will never come here again. They did however comp our meal.

My husband and I went here (Everett Red Robin) for years and it was consistently good but in the last year something has happened.  Service is horrible, food takes forever and 90% of the time food is cold.  Thought we'd try it again last night just hoping something had changed for the better....but nope.  Horrible.  Runny warm milkshake brought after we received our lukewarm meal.  French fries were cold so we asked for some hot ones.  Guess what? We finally got them served by a runner while we were paying our bill.  Huge disappointment!  We have been apologized to by a manager so many times saying sorry they are understaffed that evening but they are ALWAYS understaffed now.  Don't waste your time here.  Go to the Smokey Point Red Robin.  The atmosphere and food are never a problem and great service too.

The last two times my family and I have been here we walked out before we even sat down because we were so disgusted. Every time we got walked to a table the table is sticky, there is sauce and food all over the seats, and the floor is disgusting. This time before we left I asked to speak with a manager. I told her that she needed a customers outside review on this place. I told her exactly what I just said earlier and she said she just fired the last busser and hired a new one but maybe she should have kept the other one too! I am just a little shocked because what was going to be our waitress agreed that it was disgusting and so did the manager but yet I don't see any of them doing anything about it. If you know as a manager your restaurant is gross then why don't you pick up a broom or mop... Why is it Everytime we go in there it gets worse? This place is seriously going downhill and upper management needs to step in.

Went here this weekend (the 4th) with my parents. My mom and I both ordered a Nacho Tavern burger without a bun. The burgers came out with no bun, but no nacho sauce or anything "nacho-ey" about them. Mine had pepper jack cheese, my mom's did not. They also don't put tavern sauce on it if you don't get a bun, but we didn't know that.  After letting the waitress know, she apologized and the manager came over and righted the mistake. It was great to not be made to feel guilty for not getting what we ordered! We were treated very well and will definitely be back to this location after the experience.  My dad and my husband's burger's neither one lasted very long...they must've enjoyed them. (;

Worst service we've had in a long time. Served half our party a full 20 minutes before the rest. The food took 40 minutes for the first of us to be served and a full hour for the rest. Zero stars would fit

2.5 stars would probably be a better indicator because our experience was largely meh but another customer there made it good :) We came on Easter Sunday with our 4 kids. I expected crowds but it was empty. We were seated promptly but the extra flap they lifted at the end to make room for the high chair was tilted. In fact, both our tables had a tilt and we spent most the meal trying to catch crayons, toy cars (the baby doesn't go anywhere without his Lightning McQueen and Mater car) and even drinks and food from careening off their edges.  Our waiter was distracted and distant. He did not clear empty cups off the table even after bringing refills. Thus our table cluttered up immediately, especially since a wide swath had to be cleared in front of the toddler to avoid messes. We ordered onion rings and fried zucchini to keep the kids happy until their meals arrived. Both were undercooked, particularly the zucchini which was very crunchy. The onion ring batter was good, but the onion itself was really thick and hard to chew. Our food came and it was meh. I think we might have been spoiled by Blazing Onion. I had the Blu Ribbon burger. It was ok, but bun was untoasted (pet peeve) and the onion strings were underdone resulting in a shoelace like texture and appearance with every bite. Bleh. Husband's burger was mediocre as well. Two kids had pizza, two had chicken strips. Chicken seemed fine, but the pizza was abysmal. Cheese was super thick and not hot enough.  There was an elderly couple sitting behind us and we exchanged some kind words with them during the meal. They paid for us (not cheap to pay for 6!) and we were so touched. Its what made this kind of icky meal a great experience. Thanks anonymous elderly couple!

This is hands down the worst Red Robin I have been to. I frequent the Lynnwood location as I always have incredible service (and they will be receiving a great review after this). I have never had a good experience here, but today was the worst experience.  We were told the wait would be 10-15 min, after 40 we got our table. It took another 20 to put our orders in and once our food came out some time later (understandable for the wait) we only got half our food. Once the other half arrived, half the table was done eating and the fresh food wasn't hot. One of the dishes was incorrect which delayed it even more and caused their food to sit and get cold while waiting for a new bottom bun. We also never received refills until we were done eating... For a Wednesday night and an arrival time of 5:45, I just didn't expect it to take so long. Our party was an average size of 4 adults and 2 kids. I understand that restaurants can get short staffed, but when there is cold food, longer waits than we were told and zero times we were followed up on until the end, it's just not a good experience for anyone.

DIRTY!!!! Our 7 year old loves Red Robin...until I showed him how dirty the place was.  This place seems especially dirty.  See my uploaded photo titled "DIRTY" showing the filthy wipe from wiping our seat a few times. We won't be going to Red Robin again. I hope the management reads Yelp.  I made the point of contacting Red Robin corporate to address the issue.

I have nothing good or bad to say about this restaurant in general, typical joint that features ten dollar cheeseburgers. This location, however... I had been to this place twice before in the year since I moved to this area. After the second time I decided not to return. Today I decided to give them another shot, my sister was in town and she usually enjoys their food. This was a typical day at this location, which isn't good news. We were seated in view of the kitchen, and were able to view first hand the reason our burgers came to us room temperature. Both burgers sat under the heat lamp for at least fifteen minutes, probably more. Unappetizing as he'll. To make things worse, when the manager came by at the end to ask how it was, she couldn't accept "no, just let us pay and get out of here" as an answer, despite the fact I kept repeating it OVER AND OVER. She just prattled on ENDLESSLY with stuff like "I can have them make another, maybe a different burger would be more to your liking" and what have you. The only reason I told her in the first place was to be a nice guy, but now my patience was growing thin. Told her I needed to go (yet again). Now she starts asking me what I had to do that day after I left. I kid you not. I had more than enough at that point, told her that I didn't know what I was doing later, but it would be better than this. PLEASE GO. That pretty much sums up my trip to red robin today, do yourself a favor and drive over to the alderwood or Smokey point location if somebody else's ten dollar cheeseburger won't do. I also wanted to add that it wasn't that busy at all (go figure), it was the beginning of the day, about an hour or so after they open.

Typical red robin food... Fancy tableware with low quality grub. Maybe that's why you get AYCE steak fries.  Btw, thanks for the $2 entertainment fee. My tip just decreased with this unannounced item on my bill. Very disappointed with RR and will not return. Will be spreading the word about this poor use of technology!!

I went for a quick burger and bottomless fries on a Saturday night around 7pm. I knew that coming in it would be pretty busy but that I could always sit in the bar with my friend. We found a table behind the bar really quickly, I figured we were really lucky.  We ordered drinks first, I wanted to try a new drink a Pear-tini they advertised, I thought I would step out of my usual drink for once and try something new. The drink came quickly but tasted nothing like pear, can't quiet put a finger on it but it wasn't for me and hey that is what I get for trying a new drink. I asked if I could order my regular vodka, redbull. When that arrived it tasted like mint, (funny thing when I asked for a different drink after the pear-tini the waitress asked if it tasted minty) I didn't want to be a jerk and just figured I would deal with it.  Then we ordered food, gourmet cheddar cheese burger, NO PICKLES, and the garlic fries with seasoning. My friend ordered onion rings and a double tavern (nacho). Food came out and My burger had onion rings, and pickles, and my buddies had regular fries. The waiter that came to bring us food I told them that the rings were hers and asked if I could get the garlic fries I ordered. He said sure. Then another waiter came by about 20 min later and I caught her attention and asked for the fries, she said of course shed get them ordered right now. Then our regular waitress came by and I asked about my fries and she said she would check, and ended up reordering them. We finished our food, we waited about another 30 min after we finished our food, no fries yet. I asked for my check.  SO food was wrong, drink was crap, and never got fries... BUT the waitress seemed like a nice person. Maybe its just this location... it seemed like the waiters were really new.
Great service from Chelsea and had two additional people checking in on us. Very impressed with how the service has turned around here! Food was hot and tasty

I normally enjoy going to Red Robin, but after the last couple of experiences at this restaurant I won't be going back to this one anytime soon. My wife enjoys the Ava Cobb O salad but the last two times she has tried to order it the first time they were out of hard boiled eggs the next time they were out of avocado. Last night we went there and although she didn't order it, they were still out of avocado. We also heard the waitress talking and they were out of onion rings, clucks, and cheddar cheese. I can understand running out of product once in awhile but to run out and be out on a continuous basis is outrageous. We asked our waitress about being out of avocado and she told us that they hadn't been able to get it from their vendor. The problem with this is the fact that the same vendor delivers to grocery stores and they have avocados. I think that there is a management problem there and we will not be going back for quite sometime.

Maddie and Ashley were amazing! It was super busy but they treated us like we were the only ones there. We had a little girl with us that had never been to a restaurant and they went above and beyond to make sure her experience was one to be remembered. You don't find many servers like them anymore!

This place is a dump. We arrived early for the dinner rush and had to wait while the hostess decided to clean the glass doors after we walked in. When she was done she told us to wait again while she cleaned off a table. While waiting we noticed just how run down this location is, and saw plenty of open clean tables. So where did the hostess run off to? No idea. After 10 minutes with no service we left.

I was generally unimpressed with our wait staff's eagerness to serve us, and generally disappointed to see that- althoufh they charged us $.75 for sauce, they didn't even fill the cup more than 1/3rd full. Cutting corners in quality across the board.

I love this location.  My daughter and I eat here regularly. We've never had a bad meal nor have we ever had bad service.  However tonight's service was tip notch and greatly appreciated.  I'm in the customer service business and too often we hear about the unfortunate situations. It is always nice to be recognized for a job well done and tonight Rashaud greatly exceeded the service we've had here! Thank you so much for doing such a wonderful job. We look forward to our next visit and the exceptional service.
It's sad to say but I feel the service at the McDonald's down the road seems to be better than this Robin Robin.  I hope they will read the comments and make service a priority.
The bathrooms here are a nightmare at least the men's are broken toilets I walked in and one was overflow on the ground and just a disaster in there if you have to go hold it !

I've wanted to write a review (or contact corporate headquarters) for almost two years. I can wait no longer. I'm sad that this restaurant, which was my families favorite for almost 10 years, but no more. It's become a source of irritation and shock as we've watched it go down hill. Service is the main problem. Always understaffed and you know you're going to have to wait with the crowd in the tiny waiting area for a long time. You get one shot with your waiter so make sure to ask for everything you need in the beginning. They now charge $4.49 for a strawberry lemonade with free refills staff not around for refills. No more garlic fries! They have a garlic seasoning (extra charge). Not the same. Very disappointed. Bacon is cold even though I've tried to ask for it hot or extra crispy. The manager has come across as rude and condescending when we pointed out how long we waited, wrong order, our child's entree came when we were finished...he was so lacking in customer service skills that I could see my children were uncomfortable that I told him I would not accept his offer to discount our bill. The thing I dislike the most is how quickly the wait staff bring you the check. You can expect it to arrive shortly after your entrees. Last week we went for a birthday and guess what? Their free sundae (which we've always enjoyed along with their singing) has been reduced to a small 1/4 cup serving. So disappointed in this Red Robin! (Btw it really says a lot that management has not responded to all the negative reviews)

So I came in not expecting the best but at least better than jack in the box. Cold food and stale tortilla for the wraps. Flat beer also!!! Horrible experience. The waitress was nice but service was slow.

The last time I went here it was a pretty bad experience.. I had a fly in my lemonade, their ice cream mackinaw wasn't working so no milkshakes, and my fish was very soggy. The manager did come and apologize and take the fish off the bill but not a good experience. Will not be returning to this location

Ordered the pouting without mushrooms, it showed up with, sent it back, then it arrived again it had mushrooms. The waitress tried to spin it that it was our fault for asking for mushroom, then she realized that it comes with them.... Why would we ask for them crazy stupid.  Didn't comp any $. Also be careful if u look at their game apps, if u look it will add to your bill.

Our recent trip to the Everett Red Robin was truly disappointing. I've dined at this location many times, but it seems that the last several visits have gone from bad to worse. Our service was very slow and my order was incorrect. Our server would disappear and not check on us. It was frustrating sitting with an empty drink hoping someone would come by to rescue you from your parched misery. The restaurant was not even that busy, so I am a bit perplexed. I enjoy Red Robin's food, but I do not plan on returning to this location anytime soon.
Filthy restaurant. Glass on booth seat caused me to cut my knee and finger. Manager did not comp any food or drink! Food was cold. Not impressed.
I ordered wings and fries, and one beer. I got 7 fries, 5 wings, the fries were cold, service was extremely slow and the bill was $20! Why!!!

Poor service in bar. Burgers not cooked to order. Drinks went non refilled as did fries. Ordered dipping sauces that never showed up. Bar host was distrstracted and buying tablesi.stead of serving guests. We will not be coming back.

My husband, son and I have been going to Red Robin for years, but our last visit (about a week ago) was the worst of all.  The fries and ranch used to be the best, but they've changed something with the fries(we noticed this at the Monroe restaurant a few months ago) and the ranch is different, too.  Service was very slow and I visited the restroom before we left only to find it filthy, with the stall 'garbage' hanging by a screw on the wall.  I do have to say the red wine shake was delicious and the staff, though slow, was friendly and seemed to try really hard to keep up.

Horrible service. Ordered black and blue burger.  pricey burger which is fine but it should be a high quality not poor. No mushrooms. Three onions on it. Fries were cold. Waitress not putting effort to check on us. Doesn't deserve even one star.

This Red Robin has very bad service. First we walked to the bar and no one came to take our order, so we walked to the restaurant area and the same situation, not enough waitresses.  Burger was cold too.

Ok. I understand that it was Sunday and this restaurant is packed! So we signed up and waited to be called. The host said it'll take about 25minutes. That was fine, 30 minutes after,all the other customers we're called. the host just passes us by like he doesn't see us. I asked him again if there is available table already. He said "no. We don't have a table for 5 with a highchair". Then new more customers came and got them seated no less than 25minutes. So I felt we are being mistreated. Is it because we were the only asians there? Didn't want to think they're being racist but it really look like it. Finally the host came up to me  (because he saw me not being happy anymore) "We can try putting you in a little corner". I told him he could of let us sit where he sat the four adults that just came in before us. Then the host said "well we don't have available highchair." Like he was making excuses!!! We walked out of this restaurant and will NEVER!! EVER COME BACK!

The food was great but when I first got there I wasnt greeted for the first 5 minutes. I had to ask for utensils & when I asked politely if I could possibly get a fork & knife. The waitress responded with "no I was gonna make you eat with your fingers". Then I asked for a chocolate shake to go & left with vanilla.

One of our waitresses was great but the first one wasn't. Food overall was great but I ordered the western burger and it had very little onion straws so I asked for more and was subsequently charged $.75.......? Really? I got charged for what should have come on the burger?  Overall, a great consistent place.... So I was surprised by the extra charge.

I seem to have some kind of homing beacon built into me lately for Red Robin. I sincerely loved this place when I was in college, because it seemed like a place I could meet relatives close to campus and we could all have a cheap and inoffensive dinner before I turned 21. Found out later that the location where we met was the first one they built. That seemed kinda cool.  Anyway, group meals lately seem to call me home to RR somehow, like I have some kind of burger lo-jack built in somewhere and I can't quite turn it off. So not only did we end up here on a busy Friday night, but I showed up first and secured the table for everybody. Oh, well--more time to try to clear the latest level of Angry Birds to confound me. They were really nice about seating me at a big table even though everyone else was late and I was by myself. The staff is really funny and outgoing here--they're really a good bunch of kids at this location. They were swamped, they had to do that birthday song where they all have to clap and they had a bunch of birthday people to do it for, people were breaking glasses on the floor, and nobody ever seemed to miss a beat.  The food's the same everywhere, kinda like the architecture and decorations. It's a true chain through and through. I ordered a salad which was pretty decent, and big enough that I couldn't finish it. The prices were more than fair; even with a couple drinks it was $60 for 6 people. Sometimes you just have to get a bunch of people fed--if you're the only one there who really gets wound up about good food, it behooves you to keep quiet and enjoy your beer and dinner salad. You could certainly do worse. Probably quite a bit actually.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!! I WILL NOT VISIT THIS PLACE AGAIN!!! THEY DESERVE NO STARS! On most occasions, I generally like Red Robin. But I don't know if they have new staff, or bad management, but my experience was SO bad, that I left zero dollars as tip, spoke to the manager about my issues and still had more issues after that!  #1: When we walked in the door, there was no host waiting to seat us. There's a clear sign that says "Wait to be seated," so we did. No host to be seen. Lots of waiters and other people walked past us in the distance, even gave us eye contact, but no one came over to seat us. We waited almost 5 minutes, and then I got upset and went over to the bar next to the waiting area and loudly asked "can someone help seat us?" I was very frustrated. So soon after that, a lady came and sat us down with the manager. The manager made no acknowledgement or apology about the long wait for us to be seated. So I calmly asked him, "is it customary to make all of your guests wait so long to be seated," of which he seemed to be completely in shock that we waited at all. He then apologized for the experience of waiting and offered a free appetizer. He gave us our menus and came back less than a minute later, frantically wanting to take our order. Um....I don't even think I really had time to look at the menu. So we quickly ordered.  #2: I ordered a burger with no shoe string onions (clearly taken by the manager who helped us) and my burger comes out with shoestring onions. I was upset, because the manager took my order wrong! So they took it back and brought me one without the onions and apologized.  #3: We never even got our "complimentary" appetizer the manager promised us, until after our meals and I asked where our appetizer was. The waitress who finished serving us (because the manager was no where in site, or apparently had left for the day was gone) looked completely unaware that there was an appetizer at all.  Epic fail Red Robin. Thanks for making us wait to be seated way to long, getting our order wrong (by the manager) and then forgetting all together about our appetizer that you offered as free since we had a bad experience!  I won't be coming back. The staff here is SO incompetent it's ridiculous. They seemed more busy chatting behind the scenes and cleaning floors than attending to their customers needs at all. I sent my comments to corporate. I hope someone gets this location's act together!

Few times would I post a review, but the food here was terrible and the service was just as bad. Took 15 min to clean off the table, chicken came out grey, and ordered fries from the manager that never arrived. Avoid this place at all costs. We are walking out and headed to Applebee's. One star only because I can't give a zero.

Went there for their lunch special 2 tavern burgers and an appetizer for $15. All I have to say is the onion rings are the best ever always good but as far as there hamburgers are concerned I'm through with them. I just found the best burger joint ever. So bye bye Red Robin I'm off to Teddy's bigger burgers. But I'll be back when I want onion rings hands down the best I've ever had keep them coming don't change your recipe.

This location is NOT your friendly, upbeat, high energy Red Robin that the chain is known for. The staff at this location are more concerned about texting on there cell phone and talking to the bar staff then assisting guests and providing any type of true service. I dined there in the evening on 4/28 and regret my visit. My order included a Quesadea that had very very little chicken, a ton of mushrooms and unmelted cheese. The unmelted cheese tells me the order was rushed and not correctly cooked. Being it was not a health issue (the chicken was cooked) I just dealt with it. Cherry soda are served with regular coke and cherry flavoring added, but no cherry on top (like at most Red Robins). The staff is not conversational (I sat in the bar section) and did not appear to have a sense of urgency. It is sad because the friendliest person I saw was the manager when he was delivering to go orders to the bar area for pick up. He made great eye contact, smiled, offered me a soda refil promptly and I could tell he cared about his job. The staff put on a show when he was around. If I was this location management, I would review your cameras and see how things are around when there is no manager. Cell phones in plan view (chest level in the hand) will give you an idea of what associates to watch. I will still go to Red Robin , but will go to Bothell Everett Hwy now, if I am in this area though I will pass and go to Bobs Burgers.

Went on lunch break. Took over 45 mins to get food. Food was decent, but had to rush to get back to work. Never got my bottomless fries ot drink refill. If you're not going to flood me with fries, don't advertise this. Nice server, just took forever. Will not go back.
Okay first of all you don't tell a person that it might be 30min or MORE because they only have 3 servers on a Friday night. The hostesses was extremely rude. Horrible!

We frequent a lot of the Red Robins around (Lynnwood, Smokey Point, Monroe) and this one always has the worst service. The wait staff is friendly but they seem completely unorganized. Took 15 minutes to get two waters after we were seated. We asked for fries to start and they took an additional 10 minutes with no condiments offered, not even ketchup. The food is always consistently good, no complaints there. We've gone back several times hoping for a different outcome but no such luck. Will have to frequent the other locations if we want our Red Robin fix.
Went in on Fri the 13th for my birthday. The restaurant filled up quickly. We had great service.

Just finished (well only half) of a mushroom burger and I am VERY disappointed. Not only were my fry's cold but my burger was cold. I mean not luke warm but actually cold...  I have had fry's cold in the center before from sitting out, but theses were just not cooked. My burger wasn't even warm, it was actually cold in the middle. I also just over heard the manager apologize to the table next to me for taking so long to get them their order. They ordered their food before we sat down and we are getting ready to leave and they just got their food. Manager told them "we were waiting on your chicken". How long does it take to cook chicken. This RedRobin SUCKS!!!  Stay away!!!!

The food was ok but the way the waitress was taking our order was kind of misleading. I thought everything came with the already $10 burger but nah everything was extra. Ended up paying almost $60(tip included) just for two people and a baby! Ridiculous. Patties are $3.50 extra? Are you kidding? Sauce is a dollar extra too like wtf. That little thumb sized sauce a whole dollar. I know it's my fault for not asking the price for EVERYTHING but come on. Money grubbin establishment. But of course we had to tip just because we always do. 7 bucks I wish we didn't have because she should have mentioned they were gonna be extra like wtf. Why suggest and not tell us that it would be an add on? The one fuckin time I don't ask the price for everything we end up getting a shit ton extra shit. Rather eat a casino burger than their mediocre Big Mac I could buy at BK. Never had this problem at other burger joints. To be honest I regret coming here. Definitely not worth the money.

I think I have finally given up on Red Robin. It's just not good. For the price I'm paying I'll go to one of the other nearby restaurants. I went to RR for lunch yesterday with a friend of mine and his son. My friend's son has life threatening food allergies so when we placed our order he mentioned his allergies and was very clear what he needed to NOT be on his burger. It was also his birthday so he presented his birthday burger coupon to the server and was told she would get it when we were ready to cash out. When our food finally arrived of course there was a big pile of mayo on my friend's son's burger. He reminded our server that he couldn't have that. She was nice and apologetic, and immediately took it back to get a new burger. And then we waited and waited. The manager came out and apologized for the mistake, but made no mention of the time it was taking to get the new burger out. Of course everyone at the table felt bad eating, but our food was getting cold. The burger finally came out - 30 minutes later. No offer to bring the kid more fries while he waited. No offer to comp the onion rings we ordered. No anything.  Finally when we were ready to pay the bill our server forgot to remove the burger for his birthday. And when we tried to cash out with the tablet, it wouldn't let us split the check. We called the server and she couldn't figure it out so she rang everything up on her own. And she didn't get stuff split up correctly, but at this point I didn't even care. I just wanted to get out of there.  The remodel is OK. At least the tables and booths aren't sticky, but I assume given time it will be as dirty and grimy as it was before the remodel. It seems every time I leave a Red Robin I tell myself I'm not going back. And then several months go by and I return and the experience reminds me again that I don't want to come back. It's a sad cycle really. If you want a mid-range burger go to Bob's instead (it's essentially in the same big parking lot). Better service, nicer atmosphere, and you'll pay about the same.

Worst service at a Red Robin I have ever had. Will definitely not return here. No refills. Server seemed to disappear for the entire meal only to return with our check when we were finished. Not impressed. Also the seats/tables were very dirty which makes you wonder what the back of the restaurant looks like. Better options for a burger in the area!

I am really glad I did not pay much attention to some reviews. Although they are presently undergoing a renovation, service and food were on point. We went on a Saturday at about 5:15 p.m. We were second in line and the hostess took care of us promptly. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they are Atkins/Fatkins friendly. I ordered the cheeseburger on lettuce with bottomless broccoli. My partner ordered his cheeseburger with a bun and bottomless fries. For my order I asked for butter but ended up using their seasoning at the table to season my broccoli. While waiting for our order I used the Ziosk gizmo at the table to sign up for a Red Robin Royalty membership. If you do not have one make sure you use the Ziosk that's on the table so that your meal is credited for loyalty points. Service by Matthias was on point. I used the Ziosk to "Call Server". Two other servers stopped by when they noticed we used the Ziosk on the table to call our server.   We ended up paying at the table with the Ziosk gizmo which is really convenient. Really pleased and yes I will return again.

Since Buffalo Wild Wings moved in across the street at the mall, Red Robin has tried to make it's restaurant nicer. They recently remodeled the inside, got nicer tables, chairs, new wall paper, mobile ordering/entertainment device (I really like this electronic device because you can order refills of drinks or pay your check at any time without calling the waiter over). The food is the same which is average. It really is a hit or miss every time we come here. Some days the food is nice and fresh and crisp, other days are not so good like when we get old soggy fries. Seating can be difficult during the weekends for people who want to sit in the restaurant, but the bar typically always has space so I recommend sitting there regardless.

Always being with my hubby and infant... we always seem to get put in the "family section" with all the screaming kiddos and toddlers throwing fries... but it's the spot we earned now having a baby. This place has a terrible parking lot... and a smaller than most dining room. It's not in the best location but it's almost always busy. The new self-serve ordering machines are interesting... but beware you have to pay to play any games on them. So don't let your kiddo get a hold of it! The staff is usually friendly but it's usually obvious they are understaffed and expected to take on more tables because the the "help" the self-serve machines give. The food is always tasty and it's decently priced for what you get.  In all, I like coming here. It's nothing special but it's food I don't have to cook. So thumbs up from me!

This specific location has become the WORST Red Robin I have ever been to!  I assumed that my last visit was bad because of the remodel but tonight I called in an order and things were even worse!  I was told 25 minutes to pick up.  Arrived and they said I must have called the wrong restaurant because they did not have an order.  Somehow they checked around and found it and took payment.  Then they mentioned it was going to take another 20 minutes to cook it!  Outrageous and completely unacceptable.  I have given them the benefit of the doubt on 5 prior visits - maybe new staff, maybe new cooks, busy on a weekend, what else can I think of?  I would absolutely tell you not to go to this place in the future.  Any place will be better. *after 45 minutes the food was done and arrived home.  At that point when starting to eat it, we discovered that one of the burgers was raw inside and had to BBQ it at home.

Some coworkers of mine ordered to go for lunch today and we were shocked... Red Robin forgot one of our soups (okay, that sucks, but it happens), what shocked us was how BAD the Ceasar salad was. I used to work in restaurants and I would be embarrassed if I saw the Caesar we were served.

The absolute worse red robin I have ever been too hands down. First off, sat at the bar put in an order for fries and drink. Never seen fries until my food came. Bar tender was absolutely awful. They need to keep there personal convos to themselves and not degrade other employees in front of customers. What really got me was when I got my check, am not a Washington resident so I showed my license and also my military ID. She said they don't give military discounts or take off tax for out of staters. Well, for one you have too, the other is a privilege I get that. However, do not tell me red robin don't to veteran discounts because my royalty card they gave me was for all the neat discounts they give service members. Just say I'm lazy and don't want to do it or I have no idea what to do. Can't tolerate shit like that, hope the gm or owner see this and fixes these issues.

I was going to leave this alone but it keeps eating at me... A month or two ago my wife and I attended this location for a night out (we also had our 8 year old son with us). Our entire experience was less than 1 star worthy. To start they gave our son his menu in Spanish. We do not speak Spanish so my son was unable to play the games on the children's menu or even read the foods that were offered. It was a very long time after being seated before anyone came to check on us while we sat there trying to figure out what the menu items were. When they finally showed up we asked them about the menu and we were told that they only had Spanish kid's menus at the time (which I find very strange). OK we just ordered him something, I can't exactly remember what he got. I ordered the Sriracha Tavern Burger and my wife ordered the Smoky Jack Tavern Burger. After waiting for a very long time to receive our food the server arrives with our food. My son gets his, I get mine, and the server dumps my wife's entire plate on her, ranch and campfire sauce sides and all. OK. We decide to not make a big deal about it and assure the server that it's fine. OK. Server tells us that the good thing about it is that it bumps our order to the number one priority so we won't have to wait an ungodly amount of time for the replacement to arrive. Alright that sounds decent, I wait for my wife's food to arrive and our son starts eating his food. Now it's been about 20 minutes and we have seen multiple tables be served but our food still hasn't arrived. Our son is finished and is getting antsy and my food is now cold. OK. Then they bring my wife her food and how about that, they brought her a Sriracha Tavern Burger (the wrong burger). Alright so at this point we're like whatever I'm very hungry, my food is cold, my son is starting to act up and we are generally unhappy. The restaurant manager was present but never came by to see if we were OK or if we needed anything. Nobody even offered us any sort of compensation for the issues (we were drinking water and weren't even offered a drink upgrade or anything). This was literally one of my worst experiences at any restaurant literally ever and do not plan on returning to this location. I wasn't a one time customer either, we generally went about monthly for burgers and beers but no longer.

Been sitting here for an hour now waiting for our food. Nothing complicated mind you, just the bbq wraps. Pretty sure this will be a first and last visit. It's not busy so that isn't the reason. Not sure what the hold up is. When the food finally showed up the fries were too hot to eat and the chicken in the wraps were stone cold.  Wish I could give a negative. We will NOT be going back

DONE, DONE, DONE, DOOOONE with this location. Today was the nail in the coffin. Placed an order at 6:20 for pick up. Was told to give it 20 mins. Arrived at about 6:45-6:50. Was told to ask the hostess girls about my order and some guy said that he would go grab my order. NEVER came back. Had a snotty girl ask me if I needed anything informed her of the situation she was rude and said my order would be out when it was done. OBVIOUSLY! Had a nicer gal ask me the same thing few minutes later informed her also she said she would go check. Comes back to inform me they are working on my order and it would be done soon. I said forget it cancel it. She said in order to do so she would bring the manager. Watched her chase her around and just walked out. It shouldn't take over an HOUR to get a to go order out let alone to find a solution. ABSOLUTELY done.

Due to my last horrible experience with Red Robin, I was given a gift card to try them again.  I went to a different location to use the card. We were lucky enough to have a fantastic waiter named Rashaud. He was amazing, attentive, and perfect.

The food was good. I had talked to the manager to ask for a pen to write happy birthday on my little brothers balloon. I thought he was kidding when he told me no until he actually didn't give it to me. We asked if they could sing happy birthday and he said he would tell my server. He never did. And every time my server showed up it was only for a second because she was so busy! Granted it was a Friday night and she was sweet. The employees proceeded to sing to two other tables while my poor 9 year old brother looked around and said "but it's my birthday too"   I will not be returning to this location.

So our party of 11 pretty much got turned down 2 hours before closing... The hostess said how it would take 45 minutes to seat us since they only had 2 servers, uhhhh last I checked the hostess seats you. The restaurant was nowhere near packed so we could have been seated very quickly. I even suggested just seating us at different tables and just split the group to make it easier but once again discouragement. Seriously unprofessional when the hostesses lie about the closing time too when the hours are posted on the window 3 feet away. I will not return to this particular RR, it's sad that this review couldn't be a positive one but when I can't even get a seat due to incompetent and unwilling staff than it warrants a bad review. Had a good experience across the street at BWW! They happily took our business. Maybe red robin can learn some basic business guidelines from them.

So.....um..........this was the most interesting experience at a Red Robin. Ever. We came at 4:30 and asked if it was happy hour. The server said, "It's all day happy hour." To which I got a slightly confused look on my face and said, "Alright, well is there a happy hour menu or are there specific items that are on special?" She replied, "No there are no price differences and it's happy hour all day because our prices are much lower than anywhere else." I looked at her slightly incredulously and said, "So you're saying these are the prices and that's it? No differences at any point during the day?" She smiled and nodded. As if her word painting somehow changed the fact that there IS no happy hour. And that's all I asked for without looking for some kind of workaround to convince me that I'm getting some amazing deal. Which I'm not. Because it's still 15 bucks for a burger. Then I ordered a drink. Mistake number two. (First mistake was asking any questions at all.) When it arrived it was very watery and tasteless. I asked to exchange it when the waitress returned, and she wouldn't even pick up the drink to take it away and instead said these words to me: "I can't take it off the bill, you will have to pay for it anyway." My jaw fell, just a little, and I stared at her, and said "But I don't like it and would like to replace it." She said "We can't do that and you'll still have to pay for it." I stared at her, burst out laughing and said "Are you serious?" She, again, smiled and nodded. I.....just..............yeah. Food took fooooorrrreeeeevvvver to come out. Bringing us extra fries or bottomless mac n cheese was probably the most inconvenient part of her day, judging from her face. And heaven forbid we ask for extra sauce with an expectation of NOT having it tossed onto the table. Finally we left without even getting the final part of our order, because why on earth should it take 20 minutes to make a kid's root beer float? Before we walked in the door my gut was telling me the Smokey Point location was probably the better choice. I'll listen to my gut from now on.

Only giving it one star because I can't give zero. We were long time faithful customers. At least 2 times a month. Almost 3 weeks ago we visited and had the worst experience ever. My chicken sandwich was raw! My daughters burger was messed up(and took an additional 20 extra minutes for a new one), our drinks were not refilled and I couldn't even tell you who our actual server was. The manager apologized for the raw sandwich and asked to make me a new one. Umm no thanks. She offered my kids a dessert which was nice but I'm sorry because that really doesn't make up for RAW CHICKEN! No one offered to follow up to make sure I didn't get sick since I'd eaten some of the chicken sandwich before noticing. I've tried following up with corporate and still haven't been contacted like promised. We will not be returning.

Went here on Friday for dinner had no avocado for the avocado Cobb salad and haven't had for a few weeks. Ran out of chicken, onion rings  this seems like they should plan better.  This is not a one time deal they are always out of something.  My husband loves this place but doubt we will be back
Change your hours. You don't close at midnight. You guys close at 11. Got me in a hangry mood.

would give no stars if able ...will never return to this location .the hostess was sitting down when we walked in rolled her eyes acted like we were a bother then after we were seated sat back down on the other side of the partition wall where she was when we came in and told her friend sorry ppl don't know how to seat themselves and continued talking bad about other customers the entire time . they forgot my husbands veggies for his burger he asked for them on the side they brought then after he was half way in . also asked for pink in his meat there was none . my freckled lemonade was like watered down lemonade with hardly any strawberry flavoring the seat was dirty .the manager was walking the floor quickly not saying anything to anyone in attire that's not professional and obviously didn't care that her hostess was doing nothing they all need to be fired !
As always, the service was good and the burgers were GREAT. The red tavern double specials they have right now are awesome. As well as the original. They are all $6.99. Can't beat that!!

Our favorite for taking the fam out to celebrate birthdays.  Just loud enough. Good selection of food for all, including those with diet restrictions.  My favorite is the juicy banzai burger!  Tasty meet, plus the pineapple and teriyaki combo are delectable.   The tower of onion rings to start, and ice cream cake desert to to it off makes a great meal!

The Only Reason I Go To This Place Is When We Are Doing A Toys For Tots Event @ Toys R Us. Other Than That I Would NEVER Go Here. The Bartenders Are Rude & Need A Lesson In Customer Service. The Bartenders Gossip With One Another No Matter If You Are Right In Front Of Their Face. Then Ask If They Can Serve You After Their Convo Is Done..... I NEVER Tip. Maybe I am old Fashion... But I would never go out of my way to go here. I've heard major chains are failing and losing money right now.... I wonder why? Hey, Bartenders good luck on saving your jobs. You earn your tips still right?

Warning! Make sure your chicken is cooked! - If I could give a ZERO, I would. I've been going to this location for many years and it can be inconsistent. Sometimes good, sometimes not so good, and a few servers here and there that need extra training, but most of this time it's okay.  Tonight they disappointed me. My husband and I ordered to go. He ordered the teriyaki chicken burger, one of his usuals, and it was way undercooked. After a few bites that my husband couldn't chew well, he asked me to inspect it. I told him to stop eating because it's half cooked. We both could not eat our food after that. I was grossed out, so you can imagine how he feels. He called and one of the managers apologized and offered for him to come in for a free burger tonight or when we come back. When he told me that I was super disappointed. As if we want to eat there anytime soon. I plan on asking for a full refund of our meals tomorrow when I talk to the head manager. Right now my husband and I pray he doesn't get sick.

I had nearly given up on Red Robin. I love the gourmet cheeseburger and steak fries, but my visits the past couple of years were disappointing. My recent visit was fantastic. Our server, Rashad, did an excellent job. I was nervous because we were seated next to a large birthday party group in a busy section. I doubted we would get good service. I was wrong! Rashad came right away to get drink orders, and returned quickly with our drinks. We ordered nachos, gourmet cheeseburgers and steak fries. Our meals came quickly and were cooked to perfection. I am so excited that this Red Robin has turned things back around with great food and excellent service.

We were seated quickly on a Monday night. Our server came quick to take our drink choice while we waited. Our company came and we ordered. Our appetizer came hot and quick. However when our food came my daughter in law didn't get what she ordered. We had to wait a good ten minutes before we could flag down a server that looked in our general direction. Once we explained that the burger we received was incorrect it took over thirty minutes for them to bring the correct burger. At that point the rest of the table had finished eating so we needed to take it to go. By all means the server was sure to collect payment before the correct burger was brought out. The rest of the table was satisfied with their meals.

Please please please don't take away the  Berserker X Burger --  loaded with Sriracha onion straws, spicy pickles, zesty aioli, a fire-grilled, (I get a veggie patty), lettuce, tomatoes and melted cheddar on a special "X" edition brioche bun!!!! It was SO GOOD!  There were 5 of us...we had bottomless Rootbeer floats,  freckled lemonades, and I ordered the fried pickles (that came with disgusted looks and whining from the kids). Once the appetizer got to the table. ..I think I got 3....because everyone wolfed them down screaming. ..."I thought these would be nasty. ..but they are awesome!" Entrees were A1 peppercorn burger,  Rad Robin cheeseburger,  bruschetta chicken burger, chicken and clucks, and my Berserker X Burger.  Bottomless fries. ...endless belly aches. Thankfully the screaming baby didn't last long,  otherwise the atmosphere was good.  Not sure if I'm down with Red Robins whole new make over. ..but I did dig the surfing Chewbacca poster (even though I'm not a Star Wars freak). Our waitress was great. ..drinks were refilled before we had to ask,  as well as fries.  The Bruschetta chicken burger was a bit soggy. ..we've had that problem before in the past  (at a different RR). I don't know that it works that great with the buns used. ..they just dissolve too quickly.  But everything else was great.  We'll be back to stuff our faces another day! !

What started out as a four star visit eventually became a two star visit. We visited in between the lunch and dinner rush, and it was pretty dead. Beverage refills were slow. My wife's burger came out wrong and it took about 15 minutes to correct. She sat and watched as the rest of the family ate. It feels to me like once food is dropped off, they feel like their job is done- who cares if the order is incorrect? Normally service is pretty good here. I don't know what it was about today. On a positive note, this location knows how to correctly prepare and serve their Ensenada Chicken- something the Twin Lakes location still can't figure out.

Disgusted. Ordered teriyaki burger and my burger came out soaked in teriyaki sauce and my bread was so saggy, it tasted like a wet towel in my mouth. The veggies were placed so messy, some bites had lettuce, some bites had chicken, uh what.  The service was good because we self ordered everything on the iPad and all they had to do was bring it out. But we did get our drink refills in as well, so that's the least thing they could do since my food was ruined with over saucing.  I couldn't even finish half of my burger because I basically consumed teriyaki sauce than the actual burger. Definitely didn't want a to-go box.  Overall, I'm never coming to this location again. Their food is not presentable or somewhat representable of how Red Robin should be.

Red Robin always hits the spot when you are craving a juicy burger! The service here was wonderful, our food came out quickly and tasted delicious. Our waitress, JORDAN was so adorable she really made our experience great. For sure will come back and ask for her

This place was a little busy, still the service from Sarah, who was also tending the Bar, was very good. My Banzai Burger and endless fries were very good too. I recommend this place over the other place I tried across the parking lot, Bob's burgers see my review.

I want to start by saying my husband and I go to Red Robin 4-5 times a week. We came to RR the night we got married, for our Christmas dinner before and after my grandma's funeral and so on.  The experience we had in this location today however, will probably reduce our RR visits to 3-4 times a week. Let me tell you why.  First of all, host didn't smile when he greeted us. I could see my husband was visibly upset by this rude greeting we experienced. But we were starving so went in anyway.   We ordered without issues. My husband is allergic to lettuce and tomatoes so we made sure there wouldn't be any in his burger.  Last time we came here I counted 16 fries in my fry holder. Alas, this time I counted 12 fries. I of course was very disappointed by the lack of fries. However my I couldn't help but notice my husband had more fries than I had, and that felt like he was getting special treatment. They put lettuce and tomatoes on my husband's burger but not on mine. Also, they really should maker fries smaller, because I almost choked on a fry. When I told our waitress about my complaint with their fry sizes, she rolled her eyes and said there's nothing she can do about potota sizes. What happened to "the customer is always right"?   Overall, I am very unsatisfied with my experience today I hope it will be better when we come again in 2 days.

Wow! I was very impressed with the service. We were sat down right away and our waitress came just as fast. She was so great, kind, and fast. I forgot her name but she checked on us often enough but not overbearingly - our drinks came out and she even brought us a basket of fries while we wait for our food. I haven't had a Red Robin do that in a long time. So cool! Definitely helped ease hangriness while waiting for food. :D She kept our drinks filled and us comfortable. My only complaint - which isn't on any waitresses - is the setup of the entire restaurant, it's so open feeling but I saw there were other places a little less "open". Just my small thoughts. Anyways, everything else was great, our food came out in a timely manner and our waitress made sure we were still stocked with everything. A manager also came by just to check in on us and that was also very nice.  The employees were all working very hard and moving around and helping each other out really well, which can be hard with some locations where employees often just chat or stand around. This one is great so far and I hope to go back again with other friends (I went with my sister). I recommend this location! Thank you Red Robin for a great experience. Next time I will try to remember our waitress' name.

My parents moved to WA in the late 60s so my Dad could attend grad school at the UW. They loved it here and decided to stay.
