One of the things they loved about their time at UW was eating at the original Red Robin on Fuhrman Ave. After he graduated, they moved to the country and weren't able to get back very often so they were delighted when Red Robin expanded and franchised which led to one being built in Federal Way which was a reasonable driving distance from our home. I swear that was the only place they really wanted to go out to dinner when I was a kid. I've never been a big burger fanatic but I did like the Monster Burgers and bottomless steak fries. I also loved the teriyaki chicken sandwich, their wings and the clam chowder.  I moved to Colorado for a couple of years after high school and was happy to find that it had become popular there as well. It was a taste of home and I dragged all my friends there constantly. When I returned to WA and met my wife, our first date was at the East Hill location in Kent. At some point I made the observation that when I ordered refills on my bottomless fries, they usually seemed to come out a bit overcooked. I theorized that this was to discourage hungry young guys such as myself from camping out and binging on fries. One of my buddies voiced that observation to our waiter one night at the old downtown Bellevue location which I believe is now a parking lot. We probably got our drinks spit in but I have no evidence of that.  Their prices kept going up and I was soon paying nearly $10 for the Monster Burger that used to cost me around $6. At that point, I embraced my love of Asian food and took a lengthy break from Red Robin. About 10 years later, I worked in an office in Woodinville that brought in discounted lunch every day from different local restaurants. On Red Robin Day, I ordered the same thing as I had as a teenager, a Monster Burger and fries. One bite and I was hooked again. The prices were over $10 by then but prices had gone up everywhere so it was less of a big deal than when I was a newlywed. Thus followed a five year streak of regular eating and enjoyment of Red Robin. At that point, I noticed a distinct drop in the quality of the food and service. I hung on for a while but after bad service issues at the Lynnwood and Monroe locations that were bad enough that I wrote complaint emails to the company I reevaluated. The waiter in Lynnwood was so rude to our friends and us that I've never been back to that location. The Monroe manager made a great effort to make things right and it was more just carelessness on the part of a server. A good manager does make a difference but I decided to go back on hiatus. We had also had many bad service incidents at the Everett location which is the one closest to where we have lived for the past decade-plus and the food just didn't taste the same anymore and gave me indigestion.  It has been a while since I ate there but the other day, my wife was craving a Mile High Mud Pie. We stopped in for  a quick dinner and by the end of my meal, I reaffirmed that I'm done with this place. The Monster Burgers cost nearly $15 now. I ordered the Seafood Scatter which I always liked but it was about 1/3 the size it was when I was younger and cost $16+. To add insult to injury, the fish was overcooked as well. They never did bring me my coleslaw and when I asked them for a small cup of pickles to eat with my fish, they told me they would have to charge me for a bottle of pickles. Seriously, that actually happened. I had to ask four times for a fry refill, once to the manager who stopped by to ask how our meal was. I had to ask two more times after that and when it came, it was, of course, overcooked and a very small portion. They're really guarding their french fry consumption apparently.  I tell you all this long story to illustrate that I've had a long relationship with this restaurant. My folks started eating there over 40 years ago and I've been eating there for at least 30. You'll never hate anyone or anything more than someone or something you once loved who/that let you down hard. So long Red Robin. In my end of town, I have Bob's Burger and Brew, Blazin' Onion and several other better alternatives now. When I'm in the mood for a burger, I'll take my business to them. At the very least, if you had maintained the quality of your food and service, I could have gutted out the massive increase in price over the years but you didn't so I'm out.

Had a rear visit.  We came for my husband's birthday.  I really wanted them to sing to him without him knowing it was coming.  I stuck a little note on our appetizer plate praying she would see it without throwing it away. She managed to make the surprise with a cute little dessert for him. Both our burgers were excellent and our jalapeno coins were to die for.  Our drinks were never empty and everything came out hot and fast.  We've never had a bad experience here. Always had great service but tonight they went beyond so thank you!!

We are HUGE fans of Red Robin but this location is the absolute worse. All the servers look like they hate their job. The food is a mess. I usually get the banzai burger and yeah its usually messy but this one in particular was undercooked, and just covered in grease. I felt very sick after eating it. My husband couldnt even eat his food. I still feel sick after eating it last night. The only reason why I ate it was because i was starving. Garlic fries were smothered in oil. This is the 2nd time we have been there and now the last time. Take your business to the Lynnwood location if you really want Red Robin. You will be thanking yourself later.

I have been here many times. It is a decent burger place.  Tonight we decided to order online and pick up. I was very disappointed.  It said it would be ready at a certain time,  and I had to wait almost 20 min past the time. So when I got in my car I opened some of my meal. It was cold.  I got home to eat my burger and the lettuce was very limp, not like you get when you dine in. My fries were limp and cold. Makes me not want to go back.

I'm only giving one star because it won't record a zero. My wife and I just went in to grab an after movie meal. I was looking forward to a burger and some fries. The place was packed but we found a place in the bar section. My wife recently had surgery which constrains the amount of food she can eat so she asked for a kids menu. The waitress says she has to get management's approval. (WHA?!?). She goes away and five minutes later comes back and says "I'm sorry but my manager says we are unable to serve you a kids meal". My wife is now embarrassed. We go to Bob's across the parking lot. Seriously?!  Red Robin you continue to amaze. Your Monroe location can't cook a burger to order and your Everett location is rude. You've lost two customers and I've made it my mission to tell the world about your CRAPPY service.

I will not be coming back to this location.  The only reason I come here is my wife likes the fry's. We have been waiting for 35 minutes and --- nothing, wife had to flag someone down to get some fry's till our food is done. I'm done!  Just got our food. 43 minutes from ordering. And then told us we don't split open face burgers ( wife got a salad I got a burger, we each wanted half)

Got seated in the bar area which was set up a little odd.   Don't remember our waitress' name but she had dyed red hair and was super great.    She was very attentive but not annoying.   Brought out my drink refill right as I was finishing my drink and made sure to check in on us.   Food was good and we didn't wait more than 10 minutes or so to receive our order and everything was just as we ordered, substitutions and all. After it was all said and done we got side tracked by talking and unfortunately took up her table for another hour or so so I felt bad for not tipping her more than we did (even though there were still more empty tables).  Her service was excellent and she definitely deserved a great tip because she made the experience great for us.

3 stars is generous for tonight. It's usually great, but we didn't even get acknowledged for 20 min. This is the second time in a row I have had mediocre service. Still good food and drinks, but the service is subpar.
Very slow service on a Friday night food order was off... Food was good on upside. It's a good it on a go place to go to if your in no hurry.

Have never felt under so much pressure to eat and leave! Although we were the 2nd couple in line when it opened at 11:00 AM, we were still seated by the kitchen (maybe because we had a 2 yr. old with us?). When I asked why, she told me this was the only section open. Our server, Ian, came to take our order immediately after we sat down,,,,,again and again and again! I finally  said "could we look at the menu first?". I ordered the Banzai burger and he said "fries, soup or salad"? Since I knew my partner was getting the fries, I ordered the soup. After getting our food I was extremely disappointed in that I couldn't even tell what kind of burger it was; it clearly had pineapple on it but I couldn't taste it and it clearly had cheddar on it but I couldn't taste that either. Don't know if it had teriyaki on it  'cause I couldn't taste or see that either. Ian kept coming over and asking if we were ready for our bill and since we had just started eating I said "In a bit", he brought it over anyways and imagine my surprise when I was charged for the soup! When I questioned him about it, he said "Oh yeah, soup is extra". Never did he come back to ask how the food was, if we needed a refill or if we wanted dessert. Clearly, this was a man in a hurry. For what I don't know as there were only 2 other tables in his section, (granted one of the tables was quite large) . So now I remember WHY I stopped going to Red Robin 5 years ago (even though they are across the street from where I work). Lousy food and lousy service! I guess if you're in your teens and go in with a bunch of friends it wouldn't be so bad. The soup was good, though!
Typical Red Robin, always busy and a bit messy. Our server was Robbie and did an awesome job. Checked up, refilled drinks and joked around with us. Good burgers and beer.

The staff here has super impressed me the two times we've had a meal. It's not my neighborhood, and I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but sometimes I don't get to choose. *smile* That being said, their new line of "fancy" burgers for $13 are decent. Still, the reason I'm writing this review is the staff. Some pals decided to have a birthday party for their 3 year old here with 30 guests!! Holy cow. I didn't know you could even make a reservation for a group that large at a place that doesn't have private rooms. The staff was amazing. They basically blocked off one section of the restaurant so we could get tables all together. They were about 20 minutes late in seating us because they had to wait for ALL the tables in that section (6 or 7 tables) to finish eating and leave. *smile* Seriously, though, the wait staff was amazing. They brought out some fries immediately (before we ordered) because some of the little kids said they were hungry, on the assumption that at least one person in our group would order a meal with the unlimited fries. Very cool. And the waitress even squirted ketchup on the plate for the 3 year old when the adults nearby had their hands full.  They were amazing at separate checks and getting that all sorted at the beginning. Food came out in a timely manner. Just, way above and beyond what I expected. Bravo!

It was Red Robin.  The food came out quickly and hot.  Our server was nice.  2 annoying things though - the stupid "Red Robin Yummm" advertising that loops through their music every so often and they seemed to be out of everything yesterday (hot fudge, mint tea).  I felt bad for the people who wanted those. Try the campfire sauce for your fries or other dipables.  I think it's newish and it's yummy - like a lighter BBQ sauce.

This particular red robin is terrible. Every time I have been there the service has been terrible. The food is sub par. Things like limp cold bacon on burgers, WAY too much mayo, not cutting the burger in half when we want to split it. Things that say the Alderwood have down. No plates when our onion rings came. Never asked if we wanted sauces. I could go on. No need. This is a no go for us in the future.

I love Red Robins but this location is not as good the one in Seattle the food taste different Talking about service is blaaahhh our server never ask if  you want salad or fries even she lied at the beginning about the meal comes with choices salad or fries She was nice to  our daughter but we dont buy that  She doesnt realize people go to restaurant they deserve good meal and good service thats what people paid for I dont think this restaurant will stay long i rather go to IHOP just saying

This has to be the worst Red Robin I've ever been to. I've been there twice now and both times were umm...pretty bad. The wait times both times were longer than at other Red Robin's. The first time we were stuck in a back corner surrounded by big parties and received lousy service (one of the reasons being our waiter was socializing with some of the patrons). Both times the staff (all of them) seemed disorganized and all over the place. The entrance/waiting area is dirty and there isn't an official check in area. The food was okay the first time. But the 2nd time it was horrible and it took us an HOUR to get our food. My chicken sandwich had maybe a teaspoon of guacamole. The gluten free bun was dry like I was eating sawdust (apparently they use the worst gluten free buns ever...Udi's multi-grain!). The chicken breast was dry and was really small. I managed to flag down our waiter and get some guacamole, so I could try and eat the damn sandwich. My sweet potato fries were cold. My hubby tried one of their new burgers but it was incredibly dry and overcooked. He loved the sauces on it, but it couldn't save the fact he was he eating a hockey puck. The staff kept running around like crazy the whole time we were there and our waiter and a manager apologized for the wait saying it's not usually this busy on a Tuesday. But they didn't comp anything. Even after I complained about my food. There were many tables that sat unclean with napkins and drinks for a long amount of time. We were there so long we had plenty of time to make observations like that. Oh yeah, homeless people like to hang out by the entrance.

I've always loved red robin, even worked for them for awhile... However, the service at this particular red robin is appalling. I will never return to this location, instead drive to Lynwood or Smokey point. If you want speedy, accurate service, avoid this location.
Very refreshing to hear from the owner of this location; her acknowledgement of the concerns is indicative of someone who values customer service!

So I'm from The UK and my Wife is American, we live in the UK and i think other than her family this is what she misses the most. I really like the cheese sticks in fact i think they are the best cheese sticks iv ever had. I like the fact its bottomless fries in this place but i usually go for the sweet potato fries which are bloody lovely!!! We did have a creepy waiter who brought us a box and kinda waved it in front of his crotch and said "is this big enough" i don't know if he did this on purpose but it was weird and abit off putting. Overall i really like this place and ill 100% be returning

Of all of the places that my wife wanted to eat for Valentine's Day, it was RR... Bottomless fries? I don't know but since I love the gourmet burger options, great! We wanted to eat and then head over to Regal for the Kingsman, good movie I thought. We needed to hurry, ordered an app, the 7 pc. boneless buffalo wings, kind of small in size. Our server, a young blonde guy, who was self-effacing about his weight, was very responsive. Since we had the app, we weren't really hungry so we decided to order an avocado burger with the avocado on the side, no tomato, with the sandwich cut up to split. It seemed a little packed on this Saturday, with others enjoying the VD as we were, food took awhile. The server, sensing our growing frustration at either having to miss the food or the movie, spoke to a manager, who came over and made sure that our food was rushed and brought to us asap. He was standing there when we got our food, which had the tomato on it (I'm alergic), and was not cut... When our server, I think his name was Brian, brought the check, he alerted us that the burger and fries were comped by the manager.  Lunch for $5.65. The server got a nice tip:-) I rate the cooks service a three, the server a 5, the manager a 5, an average of a 4.3 Bon apetit.

RR is the only chain to offer FREE-not BOGO burger on your birthday month-thats what keeps me a loyal customer,I dine solo so other 'free' bd offers mean nothing to me. But disapointed they switched to soft serve for shakes-that is NOT classic-classic shake use real(hard)icecream.Also wish they bring back the 'fair burger'! I go about 5 times a year and have always had good service,they bring tartar sauce for no extra charge.I always go right at 11am or wait til 1 during the week, so have never had a wait If you go often-I think after 10 visits you get free burger .If you go ON your birthday and tell them-you get a free sunday. Seems like kids just love this place-theres free baloons.The staff sings 'happy bday'to you. You can spend $5 for burger at fast food-so I like RR when have craving for fries-add that to fastfood and you're paying just couple bucks more for a gourmet burger. They now offer smaller size of the onion ring tower There is parking just across from the entrance for to go/call in. Overall RR is a yummy place that does not disapoint.

Red Robin is within walking distance for us so it's a favorite haunt for happy hour when Guinness (and other tap beers) are half off! I'm totally in love with their Burning Love burger and the endless fries don't hurt, either. Last night we tried the fried zucchini and it was delish... but the batter would probably have stayed on better if they dried the slices a bit before breading. As it was they were a little hard to eat. We usually are there for Happy Hour so we like to sit in the bar where there is typically no waiting (your mileage may vary on Fridays and Weekends) and the staff in the bar area is super attentive. I can't really speak for table service in other areas. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is they (annoyingly) still cater to the birthday song crowd, thus a good time may occasionally be punctuated by off-key singing and screaming children running around; and while that isn't really the fault of staff... it can detract from the atmosphere.  My advice... go late... sit in the bar... and it's all FIVES! :)

I have been a long time fan of Red Robin. The food is consistently solid and the staff is nice. What surprised me about this visit was the presentation. The baskets and the paper wrapping around your burger are gone. Now your burger comes out on a stylish plate and your fries are in a silver round container.  One of the staff told me that the restaurant is remodeling and moving toward an older crowd. The bar is being extended, the presentation is much classier and they are moving away from the kid appeal.  Nice change!
My girlfriends mom fell in love with the waiter and ran off with him, but the burger was alright. Maybe too many mushrooms. 4/5 stars 'cause she hasn't come home yet.

SO a few weeks ago, my boyfriend got the A.1. Peppercorn burger. He asked for a little pink. When I got home he started to eat it and it was CHARCOAL. And I meant BURNT. It was the thinnest patty I have ever seen. I went back and right when I got there I happened to bump into the manager in the parking lot on my way into the restaurants anyways he brought me back inside to find out more about why I came. Gary (restaurants manager); I showed him the burger and was happy to make me a new one. He was very nice and gave me no grief.  I wish he would retrained his employee's.  *Not to self whenever I go HERE or & ANYWHERE else check your food that you ordered.

Most terrible experience I've ever had, waiter made racist jokes about me, asking if I wanted kool aid or watermelon because I'm black. Totally uncalled for, the food took 2 hours and it was overall the worst experience ever. NEVER RETURNING TO THIS RESTAURANT EVER AGAIN.

Fries were delivered with blue plastic flakes on them from food handler gloves. Server said all food handlers had changed their gloves but when I asked 2 of them, they looked at me with a blank stare and the manager, Angela Orr insisted I leave.

After giving this place a second chance, I realize they weren't just having an off-night.   From the moment we walked in the service was horrid.  The greeter was the most unpleasant person as she rolled her eyes at us because we couldn't hear her over all the people. She was obviously perturbed that they were so busy.  But maybe you should re think your decision to work in the service industry if you're going to be rude to everyone.  I wish I knew your name so I could report you to the management..  it's a thin, blonde girl with long hair and pointy nose.  Probably around 16-18. After being seated and we ordered an appetizer, our plates were dirty with greasy smudge marks on them. Then after ordering food, we waited for 45 minutes for our food to come..  When it finally did come, they had one of the orders wrong and the egg on my burger was severely under cooked and still translucent.  The fries were cold, not fresh and had probably been sitting in the back for a couple hours. We partially ate our less than mediocre meal and got the hell out of there and we will not be going back. The only saving grace was our server who did her best to apologize profusely for things that weren't her fault. Get your shit together Red Robin.

Our server right now sucks something fierce. Plus we've been seated for 50 minutes, took too long to even get greeted and have our drink orders taken by our server, finally got appetizer and now still waiting for dinner, it's been at least 35 minutes since we ordered our main course.

One star for hostess greeting. Service was horrendous. Waiting forever to be served. Waiter took our drink and appetizer order, disappeared and then came back with appetizers. No utensils or drinks until asked. Then had to call waiter to take our dinner order. Sitting here waiting for our food debating on walking out. Not even crowded.

We had the BEST service here for lunch today. Our server was great he was prompt and was great with all our special requests. He kept our drinks full and gave us all the sauces we requested. When one of our orders came our wrong he was more than willing to fix it but it wasn't a big deal we ate it anyways because it was still good. Overall great service and good food we will be back.

ughhh, I use to love this place, the garlic fries are gone, now they just put garlic powder in them, WTH? the service is so slow....., we literally waited 10 minutes to get the drinks, with a half empty restaurant!, the burgers are not tasty like before, definitively not trying again

Red Robin - Everett Mall Area OVERVIEW:  If you have eaten in one Red Robin, you have eaten in them all.  Consistent high-end yuppie burger restaurant similar to Applebee's.  You will always find good food here with nice size helpings, pleasant atmosphere and reasonable service. Good for small groups, family and children.  But, it is a little pricey.          LOCATION / Parking:   The restaurant is across Everett Mall Way from the Everett Mal - good location.-- 1305 SE Everett Mall Way Everett, WA 98208.  Strip mall parking.   HOURS:  Open Monday through Sunday - good hours.   PRICING:   Mostly in the $ 10 to $ 20 range.  Lunch menu.      SERVICE: OK.  5 to 10 minute service dependent on time of day.  Can vary between a rating of 3 and 5. MENU: American traditional.  Typical high-end burger restaurant cuisine with some great salads and French fries. Nicely presented food and a good MIX for the menu.        RATING:  It is OK - Yuppie burger place.  You will not be disappointed -- worth a visit.  Pr icy but excellent burgers.

5 alarm burger Yummmmm Not sure why people drop stars for this being a loud restaurant. There are plenty of other places that serve good burgers. So if the noise is bothersome or you don't want to hear the happy birthday song a few times while you are there then there is Bobs Burgers 2 blocks away (also has awesome burgers). But if you like a fun staff, want a good burger and watch the game with friends then it's a good place to be

Gourmet burgers & endless fries. What else can you ask for? Services is entirely depending on your server, ranging from great to really bad. Food is not always cooked right, but they always fix it right away. Overall, for the price, you can't really complain.
I'm sitting in red robin right now. No food. I've been waiting for 45 minutes.... Service is horrible! They are very nice people. But they do not know how to serve food. I'm very disappointed.

After we sat in the bar we waited a couple minutes to get greeted. We immediately put in our order witch were both salads. I asked for no tomatoes. After 35 minutes of waiting we finally got our salads the chicken was very cold. So we asked if they could remake them. After 10min we got our salads once again only to receive a very small portion of salad and one of the crispy chicken not being cooked all the way. And having tomatoes on my salad. Seriously I should not have to wait almost 50min for a SALAD. How hard is it to make it right the first time. This is my third time getting bad service I will NOT come here again.

My family has been eating at this Red Robin for years.  We've always had great service and great food..... until the last 6 months. We eat here about once a month,  sometimes more often. Yesterday was probably our last time there since the food was absolutely terrible,  perfectly matching the service.   It took a very long time for our server to greet us and get our drink order, so long in fact that we were ready to order our meals. We ordered an appetizer to come before the meal,  it arrived 25 minutes later, our meals arrived 30 minutes after that. 4 of the 5 meals arrived but the fifth never came out, we actually had to flag down the server to ask if it was coming,  she told us she needed to put in a new order.  That was my 12 year old sons food so I  shared with him since he only wanted French fries.  His order finally came to the table when we were ready to leave. All the other meals were delivered to the table cold,  without any of the sauces that were ordered, and they looked as if they had been thrown together or dropped and re-plated. The sweet potato fries were burned and hard, not edible. The waitstaff that was assisting our server were totally rude,  yelling back and forth about the table numbers and whose order went to which table, it was very immature and obnoxious.  It was a really unpleasant dining experience. We spent $90 for food that was worth maybe $30 at a drive through. Since the quality of food has deteriorated over the last 6 months we won't be back to this location. We'll drive to Alderwood from now on.

How's the saying go... "Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice, shame on you". Well shame on you Red Robin. For the third time, I have been disappointed in not only your service, but your nonchalant attitude and your clear disregard for the customer. I'm sure this post won't make a bit of difference, considering you have us "customers" by the balls. It's unfortunate that Customer Service has changed so much since I was in the business.I hope a competent competitor can oust you, not that it would take much.

They've changed their appetizer chicken wings to a gross over cooked small version that now come on top of cheap chips rather than being served with veggies. This is in addition to the mashed potato fries which have never been good. We will not go there again.

I like Red Robin, but this location isn't my favorite.  They never seem that interested in providing service to us.  I've had waitresses who have spent endless minutes talking to the table next to us about what drinks they should order and then barely refilling my Diet Coke. I've had waitresses deliver the wrong burger to my table twice in the same visit, even after verifying the name (and no, the names weren't similar enough to be confused).  Just not impressed.

I got the jalepeno burger and it was really good!  I love the seinfeld george picture. makes me laugh :) the service was great and the waiters were really nice, although the guy that was our server seemed like he  wanted to get us 'out of there because he kept asking if we wanted to have him to take our check lol. the food was really good, and after i went here, i signed up for there  royalty club memberhsip online, its free, and you get a free appetizer, free bday burger, if you come in 5 times 'in 5 weeks you get a 20 dollar gift to use and last but not least  buy 9 and get the 10th free! :) i advise you to get this before you go. other than that i would recommend this to anyone :D
Looooooove it. Best Mac n Cheese ever, besides mine of course

Outstanding service, delicious food, great price. Danielle was our waitress. She was on point with everything. Kind, courteous, knowledgeable, Gave us enough time to decide what we wanted to order. Didnt linger or neglect us, refilled drinks like a ninja, and even calculated the calories up for my buddy's meal. I had the bacon cheeseburger w/ a cherry coke, and a chocolate shake for desert = $15

I really like this chain but overall the quality is going down. I went to this location last week with my husband on my lunch break and it was less then desired. We ordered - which took an extremely long time. Ordered fries as app, which we had to ask about twice (then the waitress said they're cooking) as we watched every table around us get some. Once our food came she came back once and then gave us the bill. I really think Red Robin needs to go back to their fundamental customer service ways instead of just banking on people returning for the food.

This is going to be brief.  Been here a few times and they have all equally sucked so I don't know why I went back each time.  After today, I will not eat here anymore, even though my burger was delicious.  After being seated, my girlfriend and I sat for about 15+ minutes and the waiter never stopped by our table.  I walked to the front and informed the hostess that we have not been helped.  She was appalled and was very apologetic.  She ended up taking our order.  No tip was left because...ummmm...well...the service sucked!

What can I say about this restaurant: It has amazing food Amazing Staff Really Keeps The Place Clean Me and my friends were going to go to Famous Dave's but one of my friends suggested Red Robins. I been to a couple of Red Robins before but this one beated my expectations sky-high
I've always loved red robins for their burgers and customer service but at this location it lacks in taste and especially in service.
I love Red Robin, the stuff is always so up beat! The fries r the best, I would love them to bring back my fav quesadillas:)

Go in and get their Red Robin Club card (activate it on-line).  You get a free appetizer and then a free burger during the month of your birthday. (As well as other promotions, check it out on-line.) The staff are friendly and the fries are bottomless. You can also order a bottomless root beer float, that is HUGE! It can be loud and busy, but that is what should be expected for a family chain restaurant.

I've never yelped in my life because I work in a restaurant as well and hate ignorant people that have nothing better to do than complain, but I was super bummed tonight and thought it was necessary. My boyfriend and I eat at red robin almost every week, (usually the one in Everett) since it's fairly cheap and quick. We come because it's consistent and you always know what you're gonna get. Tonight we sat down around 7:15 and ordered shortly after. Our server was great, super friendly and attentive, but our food took an hour to get to our table. I'm assuming the kitchen was short staffed or something. I'm a server myself so I know things can happen and it can get backed up in the kitchen and get really chaotic. The biggest thing I was disappointed in was that the manager never made an appearance to any of the tables in our section to apologize or even address the situation. I'm used to management staying on top of these sort of situations and being more present. We had to finally ask to speak to a manager. At this point we were tired of waiting around so we just paid. One of the managers came out and apologized explaining they were extra busy tonight, which we understood. It was more the chain of events and lack of communication that we didn't appreciate. We still love Red Robin and will continue to visit, but hopefully next time things might be handled differently.

First time at a Red Robin chain tonight. Not overly impressed.  Burgers were decent (although I asked for mine with "a little pink" but it was certainly greater than well done), but certainly not anything to write home about!  Had heard about the "bottomless fries" but our waitress never asked if we wanted any refills, on fries or drinks for that matter.  There are better burgers around, and better service as well.

I love Red Robin. The burgers are great, never had a dish I didnt like, for a chain, it isnt bad, not 5 star quality, but a good way to cure your hunger. HOWEVER, the only beef I have is with this location in Everett.  I have only been here a few times and that was enough. The last time I came here with my bf, we saw about 3 different waitresses. Each came to our table, asked us the same questions. Of course this isnt a bad thing, just a mix up, but my god, how rude the employees are here. I dont expect much but at least look me in the eye a few times. Also, when our drinks arrived, about 5 mins later, another waitress also came up with drinks(cokes) but when she realized that we had just received a couple cokes, which were still very full, instead of taking them back, she put them on our table and left them there. So we got to enjoy watching 2 full cokes get watered down on our table, as we drank the ones we already had...we looked  like we were super thirtsy and couldnt wait for a refill, we had to have to refills NOW.  What made up for all that, was the food was still great, so after we ate, we pretty much forgot about the rudeness and the double coke disaster and called it good. When my bf checked his credit statement, the waitress double charged his tip. We gave her 10, and he was charged for 20.  Red Robin still have us as customers, however, not at this location. Considering we havent been here in a while, things might have changed, but I am not going to risk it. Make the trip to Lynnwood. Its not that much farther and never had 4 cokes and a double tip and rude people.

I used to love Red robin for everything. Its close, great service, great food, etc. The food is still great, but the fries are terrible now. I can buy better fries from the local grocery store. Sizes of fries is terrible.  Glass sizes are now larger, which is great for bottomless drinks. Great raspberry lemo.

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants but the last 3 visits in about 3 months (yes I kept trying) were terrible.  The wait staff is still super kind and friendly but something must be going on in the kitchen which makes the servers afraid to come and tell you how long it will be.  When they are busy I don't expect prompt service but we have waited exceptionally long regardless of week day or weekend visits.  Last visit we ordered 3 meals and eventually the server came over to tell us we were just waiting on one burger to be finished.  By the time our food was delivered (chicken burger, hamburger, hamburger) the one that we were waiting on was completely raw inside.  The manager did comp the meal but this continues to be a problem at this location.  Not sure if they have new ownership or kitchen turnover but they need to step it back up.  After this 3rd time of poor service we will not go back.  I do not believe the renovation has anything to do with it either.
My #1 Burger, I can't think to try eat any other burgers instead of theirs.

Ok you aren't going here for some fancypants meal, it's for burgers! And it is damn good.  I get the Royal Red Robin Burger on Ciabatta bread with no tomatoes. It is pure perfection. The fries are also good, and they have pretty yummy seasoning to put on them.  One note: they have the strangest tasting diet coke. Seriously, every single time it tastes funky.

I usually don't eat much meat, but I have to say, I really enjoy the occassional Red Robin burger. If you go there in the afternoon or a week night it's usually not too crowded, you get your food quickly, and lots of attention from your server. It's basically always a mistake to go on a Friday night; kids crying, running around, and yelling, very busy servers who don't always have time to stop and ask if you need more of anything of fill your water, and overall it just seems to be a meeting place for obnoxious, noisy people. Last time my boyfriend and I made the mistake of going on a Friday night, there was a party of about 12 people sitting right next to us, all women in their early 20's wearing pajamas (weird), screaming every couple of seconds, discussing things loud enough so that the whole place could get the 411, and bouncing on the booth seat that I was also sitting on. Our server was really nice and said she was so sorry that they were so loud, of course it's not Red Robin's fault that they attrack the crazies on weekend nights, though.  The guacamole bacon burger is my favorite, and the garlic fries (extra crispy) are pretty much heaven on earth. The blue cheese burger and the mount olympus burgers are pretty tastey, too.  Only twice have I had issues with the food or service, and if you mention it there they will fix it and appologize, and if you email them they'll call you and appologize and send you a gift card, which is really nice, good service for a chain.  Last time I went I ordered my burger well done and I took one bite and it was BRIGHT pink all throughout the burger, which grosses me out beyond belief, especially since I'm sure they get their hamburger in such huge shipments that it could easily be infected with something... I didn't complain while I was there because I really didn't feel like getting a new burger, I felt more like going to the bathroom and barfing, but I know if I write to them they'll make it right.
Good food, staff is very nice and a great place for the family to eat. kids love it and you don't feel bad for the kids making too much noise..

Very salty menu, but they offered their healthy menu, so I ordered off that. Ended up with a very plain burger I would have spiced better at home. If you like salty and/or deep-fried food, dine here. Love the ambience of Red Robin. Wish they'd just hold the salt.

Came to RR, hungry, with a friend, dashing in from the yucky pouring rain outside.  We were seated right away and our waitress, Meagan was awesome.  She was funny, had a great attitude and amazing customer service.  I ordered a turkey burger and dang... that thing was delicious.  I think I liked it better than their regular burgers which are also quite good.  Sweet potato fries were maybe cooked a tad bit too long but were okay.  I love RR and hopefully Meagan will be there next time we go!

Who is running this place?!?? I HATE this red robin due to them always being short staffed! Like how do they constantly have no workers?! Common management be smarter! This is the 3rd time they have been short staffed and theres tons of people waiting. There are always open tables but never any waiter. They sit people at the bar rather then taking us to a booth, even when we asked to be seated in a booth the hostest said no the bar will work.. Woww. Oh and what else pissed us off was the waitress claimed the shake maker was off and we saw multiple shakes being made shortly after we tried ordering one. Like wtf! We tried to tell the waitress but she never came around until she handed us our bill and we just wanted to get outta there. They need to take tips from the Lynnwood location, they are wayy better! The only reason this gets a star is cuz the food is always on point but i NEVER want to go back to the poor management running this joke.

Best burger place around. Fast service and good prices. It is a bit noisy but that is expected when you go to a busy restaurant. They also told us there was a 15 minute wait but we were seated less than 2 minutes later.

I tried Red Robin in Everett, on three different occasions. 1.  On my first visit, our order was completely lost.  This is understandable, it happens from time to time.  When we did recieve our order, it wasn't the correct order, only half of our food was correct. 2.  On my second trip, my hamburger wasn't cooked all the way and when I told the waitress she had an attitude.   3.  Third trip they set us by the kitchen on a Sunday.  It was full of people and from the moment we sat down the waitress had an attitude and slammed our drinks on the table.  When I asked for dressing on the side she huffed and puffed and rolled her eyes as though I had made the ultimate 'demand.'  When our food arrived, my salad was brown and my chicken sandwich was PINK.  The waitress tried to take my plate away as I told her my problem and tried to give us the bill without letting us talk to the manager.  During the course of the meal I had numerous asses in my face from the manager to his employees.  I did not feel comfortable.  In the end, they took the food off the bill, which I was grateful for, considering I didn't eat the pink chicken. I prefer the Red Robin in Lynnwood, better service and my food hasn't had any problems.  It's a shame since I am within walking distance to Red Robin.  I will never be back in the Everett RR.

What can I say, I like Red Robin's burgers. They are juicy and full of flavor. Wish they were bigger, but my waist doesn't need the increase :). The endless fries don't hurt either. Would eat here over Bob's Burgers any day.

Eek! I'm never coming back here again! The food was good and the drinks were awesome. I had a great time. Sounds good right? It was until I heard the floor manager clapping his hands extremely loud and extremely rudely in the drink pit next to the booth I was sitting in with my friend. He continued to talk down to three waitresses, telling them that "they can't be doing this tonight" as in the waitresses were talking amongst themselves while filling drink orders and ringing in orders. They were not just standing there talking and ignoring the customers. Our waitress, Meagan, was absolutely amazing and funny and she made me want to only go to this location until this floor manager, Gary came into the picture. Wouldn't be mad but he saw us talking to the girls in the drink pit about what just happened and we said we were sorry that happened and they were so nice and apologetic about this rude manager. He proceeded to come over to our table and ask if everything is good in such a way that it was obviously his way to try to intimidate us into not complaining or just shutting up. I thought he was so out of line and I just won't be coming back. The waitresses were extremely knowledgeable and helpful and quick! Too bad the management ruined it for me.

Wow, you might say, this person giving Red Robin 5 stars??? They have no culture and no taste whatsoever! But the reason I give this particular location 5 stars is simple. I am treated like a rockstar every time i come here! My boyfriend and I are a very unique couple, and i guess we are pretty memorable too.  We always sit and eat at the bar (A benefit of being a young childless couple!). We are always greeted by the bartenders with a huge smile and "long time no see! where you been? we missed you!". It may seem that they are just buttering us up and being overly enthusiastic to try and make tips, but they are very genuine people that work there.  I normally drink Mai Tais when i go there, because they make one of the best variations around.  The bartenders HOOK ME UP on the drinks, they are always nice and strong and very very tasty!  And the food at this location is the same menu of other restaurants, but they never burn or overcook anything, everything tastes fresh, as if they CARE about what they are serving to the customers. Ive never gotten stomach ailments from here. I love their burgers and the fajitas. I have been to the Lynnwood and Northgate locations, and have had such consistantly mediocre food, unattentive service, and an overall bad time that i used to hate Red Robin!! But im telling you this, try out the Everett location. They are what Red Robin should be. You get what you pay for and expect!!

I have to say i agree with the other review. It is an odd thing to feel so impressed by a chain restaurant, but I am seriously addicted. My girlfriends and I go here post/mid study session and the food is always great, the people are always friendly, and best of all they always give me extra pesto sauce :) I get the Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich, sub garden burger, with a side of extra pesto and extra balsamic sauce. There are not enough words for the amazingness of this stuff. If I have a little of the sauces left over I take them home and toss them on steamed veggies....so good!

Food was slow and fries were stale, likely from being out for a while. On top of it all my kids both threw up after they drank the chocolate milk. We voiced our concern over the milk but the manager exhorted that it couldn't be from the milk because "it takes about 12 hours to have reaction from bad milk." So he blamed our kids and gave us the bill in full. This was ludicrous but since we already made a scene we paid and left. Will never return here.
Great tortilla soup, wraps and burgers. Gotta love their bottom less seasoned steak fries too mmmm. Happy hour deals are also worth it
Great service, fast and friendly and delishious chicken strips and clam chowder
Micky D's of sit down, only go cuz childhood memories.. Avg for sure. Free fries tho!

The fish and chips were really greasy and they left me with a tiny cup half filled with tartar sauce that is very good but had to ask for more and it took them 8 min to bring me some from the kitchen that was less than 15 ft away...  The breading seemed really heavy and greasy.  Not sure I will try that again

My wife, two year old, and I went to dinner on a Monday.  We arrived at 6:30pm and the restaurant was on a 10-15 minute wait.  We were seated in five minutes and out table was clean and well stocked.  Our server Erica was excellent.  She was fast, friendly to my daughter, and made a nice drink recommendation for my wife (the Mai Tai was good).  She took care of all our refills without being asked and had a casual but professional attitude.  The food quality was fantastic; one of the best burgers I can remember.  We will be back!
The best fries around, my wife loves the blue ribbon burger.  A bit pricey compared to other burger restaurants.

still good but dissappointed discontinued 'hard' icecream shakes in favor of bland soft-serve for same price everyone-spec the kids having great time. ice cream desserts shoul not be over $6-yikes! BUT the ONLY burger place to offer a truly FREE birthday buger-very generous given the economy. staff super friendly/attentive and restaraunt nice7cleanthey did not charge extra for thing like grilled onions.

Won't ever go back to this Red Robin.  The ranch dressing was watered down and when we received a dessert item that was a baked item, it was frozen which of course made me realize the desserts are frozen and not fresh.

If you are looking for any of the following, you will love this restaurant: 1) Flair -- Think Office Space. There will be a small army of teens and twenty-somethings with plastic-moulded smiles. They'll speed around singing a clap-happy birthday tune and then get back to delivering bottomless french fries. When you look up the walls are covered in memorabilia--but this is Everett and nothing memorable has every happened here so-- from other places and times.  2) Grease -- The menu isn't much to write home about. The burger is good so they created about twenty versions, none of which fit between your teeth. The aforementioned fries are...fries...heavily salted.  3) Corporate Blandness -- This is the perfect place to bring someone you want to feed but don't want to get to know. With all the kitsch around, you get the sense that personality is meant to be an afterthought. Perfect for blind dates you don't want to go well, Amway presentations, and all things artifice.  4) Secret rating!!!: If you are 18 and have about five bucks (total) you can get full eating bottomless french fries and refills of Shirley Temples here. And with all the cool pictures on the wall and young wait staff you will be in heaven.

When we come to the city this is our FAVORITE BURGER JOINT!!!!! Their A1 burger is to DIE FOR!!!! and i absolutly love the service! they are quick on their feet, but dont rush you. Its an amazing dinner experience everytime!!!!!!
